Package fb.rt

This package, along with the fb.datatype package, forms the kernel of the function block runtime (FBRT).

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
Client An interface for objects (typically service interface function blocks) that service both INIT and REQ events.
EventServer The interface for elements that can service events.
INITServer An interface for objects that service INIT events.
RemoteDevice An interface for declaration of remote device types.
REQServer An interface for objects that service REQ events.
 

Class Summary
AbstractAdapter The abstract superclass of FBAdapter and FBInstance.
AbstractEvent The most lightweight implementation possible of EventServer.
Adapter The abstract superclass of all adapter classes.
DEV_MGR FUNCTION_BLOCK DEV_MGR
Device This is the abstract superclass for all device types.
DM_KRNL FUNCTION_BLOCK DM_KRNL
DM_RES RESOURCE_TYPE DM_RES
EMB_RES RESOURCE_TYPE EMB_RES
EventInput An EventServer with a single target for event processing, typically used as an event input of a basic or service interface function block.
EventOutput An instance of this class represents an event that maintains a list of destination events to be serviced.
FBClient An implementation of the Client interface with INIT and REQ event inputs; INITO and CNF event outputs; and QI and QO qualifiers.
FBInstance This class is the abstract superclass of all function block instances.
FBManager The IEC 61499 FBManager object.
INITEvent Instances of this class are typically used as INIT event inputs of service interface function blocks and other objects that implement the INITServer interface.
REQEvent Instances of this class are typically used as REQ event inputs of service interface function blocks and other objects that implement the REQServer interface.
Resource This is the abstract superclass for all resource types.
RMT_DEV DEVICE_TYPE RMT_DEV
RMT_RES RESOURCE_TYPE RMT_RES
SimpleFB A "Simple" FB whose single algorithm and CNF.serviceEvent(this) invocation is generated as the serviceEvent(EventServer) method of the main FB, triggered by the REQ input which is set to the FB itself.
ThreadedEvent An event with its own thread of execution, used in E_DELAY and E_CYCLE.
 

Exception Summary
FBRManagementException An Exception indicating that an error has occurred while executing a run-time management command.
 

Package fb.rt Description

This package, along with the fb.datatype package, forms the kernel of the function block runtime (FBRT).
